availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander L. Patton (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier - Pvt. 7th Ky. Cav. (C.S.A.))

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Patton and Margaret Patton. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from September 17, 1862 to June 10, 1864. Captured by the United States Army at Mount Sterling, Montgomery County, Kentucky, on June 10, 1864. Signed a loyalty oath to the U. S. government on January 3, 1865.
